title: Part b. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For line I horizontal at v = 1.00 m/s or at answer obtained for a.i.

1 point: For line II with monotonic, negative slope between points P1 and P2,

P1 at (0.70 – 0.80, 1.00) or (0.70 – 0.80, answer to a.i.), and
P2 at (1.20 – 1.30, 0.20) or (1.20 – 1.30, answer to a.iii.)
(This line may be straight, which is consistent with the data, or slightly curved as shown, which is consistent with the behavior of springs)

1 point: For line III horizontal at v = 0.20 m/s or at answer obtained for a.iii.

title: Part c. [0–6]
stimulusHtml:
6 points (i. 3 points; ii. 3 points)

i. 3 points

1 point: For any statement of conservation of momentum or energy

1 point: For proper conservation of momentum or energy equation

Method 1: Conservation of momentum

m A v Ai = m A v Af + m B v B ( 0.90kg )( 1.00m/s )=( 0.90kg )( 0.20m/s )+( 0.60kg ) v B MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGTb WaaSbaaSqaaiaadgeaaeqaaOGaamODamaaBaaaleaacaWGbbGaamyA aaqabaGccqGH9aqpcaWGTbWaaSbaaSqaaiaadgeaaeqaaOGaamODam aaBaaaleaacaWGbbGaamOzaaqabaGccqGHRaWkcaWGTbWaaSbaaSqa aiaadkeaaeqaaOGaamODamaaBaaaleaacaWGcbaabeaaaOqaamaabm aabaGaaGimaiaac6cacaaI5aGaaGimaiaadUgacaWGNbaacaGLOaGa ayzkaaWaaeWaaeaacaaIXaGaaiOlaiaaicdacaaIWaGaamyBaiaac+ cacaWGZbaacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaeyypa0ZaaeWaaeaacaaIWaGaaiOl aiaaiMdacaaIWaGaam4AaiaadEgaaiaawIcacaGLPaaadaqadaqaai aaicdacaGGUaGaaGOmaiaaicdacaWGTbGaai4laiaadohaaiaawIca caGLPaaacqGHRaWkdaqadaqaaiaaicdacaGGUaGaaGOnaiaaicdaca WGRbGaam4zaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiaadAhadaWgaaWcbaGaamOqaaqa baaaaaa@6A3B@

Method 2: Recognize from part (d) that energy is also conserved

1 2 m A v Ai 2 = 1 2 m A v Af 2 + 1 2 m B v B 2

1 2 ( 0.90kg ) ( 1.00m/s ) 2 = 1 2 ( 0.90kg ) ( 0.20m/s ) 2 + 1 2 ( 0.60kg ) v B 2

1 point: For correct answer vB = 1.2 m/s

ii. 3 points

1 point: For line I horizontal at v = 0

1 point: For line II with monotonic, positive slope between points P1 and P2,

P1 at (0.70 – 0.80, 0), and
P2 at (1.20 – 1.30, 1.20) or (1.20 – 1.30, answer to (c)i.)
(This line may be straight, which is consistent with the data, or slightly curved as shown, which is consistent with the behavior of springs)

title: Part d. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points (i. 2 points; ii. 1 point)

i. 2 points

1 point: For correct answer
Yes, the collision is elastic.

1 point: For any reasonable justification
Examples:

The final kinetic energy equals the initial kinetic energy.
The spring force is conservative meaning the total energy stored equals the total energy released.
The compressed spring stores and releases energy in equal amounts.

(The justification point was not awarded if student answered "no" to the question.)

ii. 1 point

1 point: For any reasonable explanation
Examples:

The compressed spring stores maximum amount of kinetic energy.
At time t = 1 s, there is maximum kinetic energy stored as potential energy.
At time t = 1 s, the spring has maximum potential or elastic energy.
